      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addColumns()
      addColumns adds a new column object to the JTable passing in the table's current column as parameter to set the header correctly

    • Constructor Detail

      • View

        public View(Spreadsheet spreadsheet)

    • Method Detail

      • createTopPanel

        public void createTopPanel()
        createTopPanel creates a panel with a textfield and buttons to be displayed above the JTable. The textfield in the TopPanel is used for entering text and formulas in the table's cells. The buttons are used to set a cell's background color and to add additional rows and columns in the table

      • createTable

        public void createTable()
        createTable creates a panel, table, and tablemodel. The model is used for the table which is added into the panel.

      • createPane

        public void createPane()
        createPane creates a scroll pane for the table.

      • createColumnHeader

        public void createColumnHeader()
        createColumnHeader creates a TableHeader to act as a column header for the JTable.

      • createMenu

        public void createMenu()
        createMenu creates a JMenuBar including a filemenu and an editmenu containing some menu items.

      • createRowHeader

        public void createRowHeader()
        createRowHeader creates a Row Header using an anonymous Abstract List Model and an array of strings representing the line numbers.

      • graphChooser

        public void graphChooser()

      • addColumns

        public void addColumns()
        addColumns adds a new column object to the JTable passing in the table's current column as parameter to set the header correctly

      • addRows

        public void addRows()
        addRows updates the table's model to add an extra row

      • updateRowHeader

        public void updateRowHeader()
        updateRowHeader updates the headers array to include the newly added rows in the tablemodel. It assumes an addition of 10 rows and adds 10 line numbers to the row header.

      • openFileChooser

        public void openFileChooser()
        openFileChooser creates a JFrame for the JFileChooser, adds it and sets visible.

      • closeFileChooser

        public void closeFileChooser()
        Closes the file chooser's frame.

      • setCell

        public void setCell(int row,
           int col,
           java.lang.String value)
        setCell sets the value of a cell as specified
        Parameters:
        row - int: Row number of the cell that is edited
        col - int: Column number of the cell that is edited
        value - String: String containing the cell's contents.

      • setTextFieldText

        public void setTextFieldText(java.lang.String text)

        JTable

        returns the amount of rows currently in the table

      • getSelectedGraph

        Returns the current graph selected in the JComboBox

      • getColumnNames

        public java.lang.String getColumnNames()
        Returns the value put in the textfield for column names.

      • resetGraphChooser

        public void resetGraphChooser()
        This method resets the graph chooser frame to account for any extra or less settings and or textfield that should be added if the selection in the JComboBox changes. It removes all components and adds the right ones.

      • closeGraphChooser

        public void closeGraphChooser()
        closes the graph chooser window
